Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with access to water and light, showing it living and growing.
The student can draw a plant without water, showing the effects of no water on the plant.
The student can draw a plant without light, showing the effects of no light on the plant.
The student can illustrate the difference between plants with and without water or light, identifying key changes or patterns.
The student can represent how patterns in these drawings help understand what plants need to live and grow.
